summary.long: 2 Peter is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Simon Peter a servant and an Apostle of Jesus Christ, to you which have obtained like precious faith with us by the righteousness of our God and Savior Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace and peace be multiplied to you, through the acknowledging of God, and of Jesus Christ our Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According as his divine power hath given unto us all things that pertain unto life and godliness, through the acknowledging of him that hath called us unto glory and virtue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whereby most great and precious promises are given unto us, that by them ye should be partakers of the divine nature, in that ye flee the corruption, which is in the world through lust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore give even all diligence thereunto: join moreover virtue with your faith: and with virtue, knowledge:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with knowledge, temperance: and with temperance, patience: and with patience, godliness:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with godliness, brotherly kindness: and with brotherly kindness, love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if these things be among you, and abound, they will make you that ye neither shall be idle, nor unfruitful in the acknowledging of our Lord Jesus Christ:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he that hath not these things, is blind, and cannot see far off, and hath forgotten that he was purged from his old sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore, brethren, give rather diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by this means an entering shall be ministered unto you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore, I will not be negligent to put you always in remembrance of these things, though that ye have knowledge, and be established in the present truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I think it meet as long as I am in this tabernacle, to stir you up by putting you in remembrance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing I know that the time is at hand that I must lay down this my tabernacle, even as our Lord Jesus Christ hath showed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will endeavor therefore always, that ye also may be able to have remembrance of these things after my departing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we followed not deceivable fables, when we opened unto you the power, and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but with our eyes we saw his majesty:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he received of God the Father honor and glory, when there came such a voice to him from that excellent Glory, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this voice we heard when it came from heaven being with him in the holy mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have also a most sure word of the Prophets, to the which ye do well that ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a dark place, until the day dawns, and the day star arise in your hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that ye first know this, that no prophecy of the Scripture is of any private interpretation:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the prophecy came not in old time by the will of man: but holy men of God spake as they were moved by the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there were false prophets also among the people, even as there shall be false teachers among you: which privily shall bring in damnable heresies, even denying the Lord that hath bought them, and bring upon themselves swift damnation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many shall follow their destructions, by whom the way of truth shall be evil spoken of.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And through covetousness shall they with feigned words make merchandise of you, whose condemnation long since resteth not, and their destruction slumbereth not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if God spared not the Angels that had sinned, but cast them down into hell, and delivered them into chains of darkness, to be kept unto damnation:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither hath spared the old world, but saved Noah the eighth person a preacher of righteousness, and brought in the Flood upon the world of the ungodly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And turned the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah into ashes, condemned them and overthrew them, and made them an ensample unto them that after should live ungodly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And delivered just Lot vexed with the uncleanly conversation of the wicked:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For he being righteous, and dwelling among them, in seeing and hearing, vexed his righteous soul from day to day with their unlawful deeds.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord knoweth to deliver the godly out of tentation, and to reserve the unjust unto the day of judgment under punishment:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And chiefly them that walk after the flesh, in the lust of uncleanness, and despise government, which are bold, and stand in their own conceit, and fear not to speak evil of them that are in dignity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whereas the Angels which are greater both in power and might, give not railing judgment against them before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these as natural brute beasts, led with sensuality and made to be taken, and destroyed, speak evil of those things which they know not, and shall perish through their own corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And shall receive the wages of unrighteousness, as they which count it pleasure daily to live deliciously. Spots they are and blots, delighting themselves in their deceivings, in feasting with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having eyes full of adultery, and that cannot cease to sin, beguiling unstable souls, they have hearts exercised with covetousness, they are the children of curse:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which forsaking the right way, have gone astray following the way of Balaam, the son of Beor, which loved the wages of unrighteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he was rebuked for his iniquity: for the dumb beast speaking with manâ€™s voice forbade the foolishness of the Prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are wells without water, and clouds carried about with a tempest, to whom the black darkness is reserved forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in speaking swelling words of vanity, they beguile with wantonness through the lusts of the flesh them that were clean escaped from them which are wrapped in error,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Promising unto them liberty, and are themselves the servants of corruption: for of whomsoever a man is overcome, even unto the same is he in bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if they, after they have escaped from the filthiness of the world, through the acknowledging of the Lord, and of the Savior Jesus Christ, are yet tangled again therein, and overcome, the latter end is worse with them than the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it had been better for them not to have acknowledged the way of righteousness, than after they have acknowledged it, to turn from the holy commandment given unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is come unto them according to the true proverb, The dog is returned to his own vomit: and the sow that was washed, to the wallowing in the mire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This second Epistle I now write unto you, beloved, wherewith I stir up, and warn your pure minds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To call to remembrance the words, which were told before of the holy Prophets, and also the commandment of us the Apostles of the Lord and Savior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This first understand, that there shall come in the last days, mockers, which will walk after their lusts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say, Where is the promise of his coming? for since the Fathers died, all things continue alike from the beginning of the creation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this they willingly know not, that the heavens were of old, and the earth that was of the water, and by the water, by the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore the world that then was, perished, overflowed with the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the heavens and earth, which are now, are kept by the same word in store, and reserved unto fire against the day of condemnation, and of the destruction of ungodly men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dearly beloved, be not ignorant of this one thing, that one day is with the Lord, as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of that promise is not slack (as some men count slackness) but is patient toward us, and would have no man to perish, but would all men to come to repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night, in the which the heavens shall pass away with a noise, and the elements shall melt with heat, and the earth with the works that are therein shall be burnt up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing therefore that all these things must be dissolved, what manner persons ought ye to be in holy conversation and godliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Looking for, and hasting unto the coming of that day of God, by the which the heavens being on fire, shall be dissolved, and the elements shall melt with heat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we look for new heavens, and a new earth, according to his promise, wherein dwelleth righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore, beloved, seeing that ye look for such things, be diligent that ye may be found of him in peace, without spot and blameless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suppose that the long suffering of our Lord is salvation, even as our beloved brother Paul according to the wisdom given unto him wrote to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As one that in all his Epistles speaketh of these things: among the which, some things are hard to be understood, which they that are unlearned and unstable, wrest, as they do also other Scriptures unto their own destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye therefore beloved, seeing ye know these things before, beware, lest ye be also plucked away with the error of the wicked, and fall from your own steadfastness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But grow in grace, and in the knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ: to him be glory both now and for evermore. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
